course.title: PSY 4105 Psychological Disorders Among Children and Adolescents (3 units)
course.desc: The course presents general concepts of psychopathology within the context of normative child development processes. An overview is provided of the major psychological disorders of childhood and adolescence, including their features and the interventions used to help overcome them. Current research in psychological disorders among children and adolescents.Course Component: LecturePrerequisite: 54 university units including PSY 1101, PSY 1102, PSY 3171, (PSY 2105 or PSY 2114). Reserved for students registered in the Major, Joint Honours, and Honours programs in psychology.
